content.question: ​The number of bacteria in a dish is <math alttext="1150"><semantics><mn>1150</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> at time <math alttext="t equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> hours. The number of bacteria in the dish doubles every <math alttext="3"><semantics><mn>3</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> hours. If the function <math alttext="B"><semantics><mi>B</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> gives the number of bacteria in the dish at time <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> hours for <math alttext="t greater or equal than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, which of the following could define <math alttext="B open parentheses t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>B</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="1150 times open parentheses cube root of 2 close parentheses to the power of open parentheses t divided by 3 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>1150</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mfenced><mroot><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mroot></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="1150 times 2 to the power of t"><semantics><mrow><mn>1150</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="1150 times open parentheses 2 cubed close parentheses to the power of t"><semantics><mrow><mn>1150</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mfenced><msup><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></msup></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="1150 times 2 to the power of open parentheses t divided by 3 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>1150</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="1150 times 2 to the power of open parentheses t divided by 3 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>1150</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.5: Exponential Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
